page.title: 02DARTMOUTH ROYAL REGATTA
page.content: Thousands visit Dartmouth for the {Royal Regatta}which has been held every year with few exceptions since 1834. It will cost about 7000 pounds this year paid for in the main from the sale of draw tickets, collections and donations. A great variety of events make up the three day Regatta in addition to the boat and yacht races. These include tennis, darts and bowling tournaments, swimming in the Boat Float and a home made raft race. One of the main attractions is the spectacular air display by the{Red {Arrows}which cost 2,500 pounds. The team are said to enjoy doing their display over Dartmouth, particularly as the terrain is so interesting. The{firework}displays on the thursday and saturday evenings provide a time of great atmosphere.
